title: North Macedonian prime minister calls for snap election after EU rebuff
text:
North Macedonia's Prime Minister Zoran Zaev | Oliver Bunic/AFP via Getty Images North Macedonian prime minister calls for snap election after EU rebuff EU leaders failed earlier this week to agree on starting membership talks with the Balkan nation.

North Macedonia's prime minister called for a snap election after European leaders this week failed to agree on launching membership talks with his country.

Speaking to reporters in Skopje, Zoran Zaev announced Saturday that he would meet with other political leaders on Sunday to discuss a potential early election.

"We have no time to waste," Zaev wrote in a series of tweets, expressing anger and disappointment over this week's EU rebuff.

EU leaders failed Thursday night to reach an agreement on whether to open accession negotiations with North Macedonia and Albania, alarming critics who warned that a failure to move forward on membership talks could destabilize the western Balkans.

On Friday, European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker branded the decision a “grave historic mistake.”

Other leaders, including European Council President Donald Tusk and German Chancellor Angela Merkel, had also argued in favor of negotiations with Skopje. Yet French President Emmanuel Macron, who strongly opposes the membership talks, ultimately prevailed.

"I thank the vast majority of European leaders who fought in favor of a positive decision for us," Zaev wrote on Twitter. "We appreciate the support and know that we can count on them in the future."
description: EU leaders failed earlier this week to agree on starting membership talks with the Balkan nation.
